subject: Public Speaking
title: Social Evaluation Threat
description: Learn Social Evaluation Threat in one minute.

hook.text: Scientists at Trier University created the most reliable stress test in psychology. It involves public speaking.

buildup.text: The Trier Social Stress Test asks people to give a speech to stone-faced judges. Cortisol spikes every time.

discovery.text: It's not the speaking that stresses people. It's the social evaluation â€” being watched and silently judged.

twist.text: When the same speech is given to an empty room, cortisol barely rises. The audience is the stressor, not the task.

climax.text: This proves stage fright is fundamentally about social threat, not performance difficulty.

punchline.text: Remove the judges and the fear evaporates.

quiz.question: What does the Trier Social Stress Test reveal?
options: Social evaluation, not speaking itself, causes the stress response
